gw.plugin.archiving

Interface IArchiveSource

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface IArchiveSource
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    This is used by the archiving system to store and retrieve graphs

    • Method Detail

      • getStatus

        ArchiveSourceInfo getStatus()
        This method will be called to get the status of the archive source.
        Returns:
        the status

      • refresh

        void refresh()
        This method will be called to refresh the source and cached status info. It is currently only called by the UI.

      • prepareForArchive

        void prepareForArchive(RootInfo info)
        This is called before checkArchiveEligibility and provides a means for a customer to do additional actions before the eligibility is checked. .
        Parameters:
        info - the root info for the graph's root object Implementation note: 1. This is called before the rootinfo is copied to the bundle that will be used for the archiving process. 2. The bundle that the rootInfo is in is the bundle of the work item, and will not be committed as part of the archive, but will be committed on a failure. Definitely not the desired commit location again, Therefore if you want to change anything use Transaction.runWithBundle 3. Let checkArchiveEligibility set the failure condition if this graph is not eligible

      • updateInfoOnStore

        void updateInfoOnStore(RootInfo info)
        This is called after the root info has been moved to the archive transaction bundle
        Parameters:
        info - the root info for the graph's root object Implementation note: Changes made here will be flushed to the database prior to creating the xml. However, they will be committed only after the rest of the archive actions are performed with all the other changes. This flush will result in event message rules run on all beans in the bundle at this time.

      • store

        void store(java.io.InputStream graph,
         RootInfo info)
        This is the archive action where the implementing class will store the xml in its external repository.
        Parameters:
        graph - the graph that was extracted and is to be saved
        info - the root info for the graph root's info object. Simple properties on RootInfo can be read from this method but array and one-to-one properties may not give the expected results. Implementation note: 1. This should also ensure that the schema for this graph is retrievable also.
        See Also:
        2. This should throw a exception if it fails to store, since a subsequent step will remove the graph from the database 3. If the exception condition is temporary (server is down) then it should throw a RetryableException so the graph's root object will not be set in failure state and can be attempted again later. 4. The root info object should only be used to set a document uid, if that is required in your implementation.

      • storeFinally

        void storeFinally(RootInfo info,
                ArchiveFinalStatus status,
                java.util.List<java.lang.String> cause)
        The terminal step of the store actions. This is an informative call after the commit has been called. This permits the external system to clean up on failures or do anything it needs in a 2nd phase commit. For example on failure by deleting the xml, notifiy someone, create activities, or ignore.
        Parameters:
        info - the root info for the graph's root object. This bean is only for read and should not be modified
        status - the final status
        cause - the exception that was caught if there was a failure, otherwise the store was successful Implementation note: 1. This maybe called from within an catch block so should not throw any exception 2. This will not be committed again, so you will want to use Transaction.runWithNewBundle if you want to make any changes. 3. If failure, the RootInfo should be refreshed, it will be inconsistent with the database.

      • retrieve

        java.io.InputStream retrieve(RootInfo info)
        This will retrieve the graph.
        Parameters:
        info - the root info for the graph's root object
        Returns:
        the graph Implementation note: 1. This should throw a exception if it fails to setup the input stream, perferably a DisplayableException

      • updateInfoOnRetrieve

        void updateInfoOnRetrieve(RootInfo info)
        This will be called after the upgrade steps and before the commit.
        Parameters:
        info - the root info for the graph's root object Implementation note: 1. This will be committed when the graph entities are committed or rolled back if restored entities fail to commit.

      • handleUpgradeIssues

        void handleUpgradeIssues(RootInfo info,
                       KeyableBean rootBean,
                       java.util.List<Issue> issues)
        This may be called after the upgrade steps and before the commit. If there are no upgrade issues it will not be called.
        Parameters:
        info - the root info for the graph's root object
        rootBean -
        issues - any upgrade issues

      • retrieveFinally

        void retrieveFinally(RootInfo info,
                   ArchiveFinalStatus status,
                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> cause)
        The terminal step of the retrieve actions. This is an informative call, so that the plugin may delete the xml, if successful; notifiy someone; create activities, if retrieve succeeded; or ignored.
        Parameters:
        info - the root info for the graph's root object. This bean is only for read and should not be modified
        status - the final status
        cause - the exception that was caught if there was a failure, otherwise the store was successful Implementation note: 1. This maybe called from within an catch block so should not throw any exception 2. This will not be committed again, so you will want to use Transaction.runWithNewBundle 3. If failure, the RootInfo should be refreshed, it is inconsistent with the database.

      • updateInfoOnDelete

        java.util.List<Pair<IEntityType,java.util.List<Key>>> updateInfoOnDelete(RootInfo info)
        This will be called within the purge transaction. This transaction will only update non deleted entities.
        Parameters:
        info - the root info for the graph's root object to be deleted
        Returns:
        List>> list of extension entity keys to be deleted in delete order Implementation note: 1. Normally this should not make entity changes, but those changes will be committed before the call to the delete method. It is an error to update an entity that will be deleted. 2. If you have created entities in updateInfoOnArchive that link to the RootInfo entity, the entity type and the keys for those entities should be returned by this function. Also any entities that link to those entities should also be in the return list. Note that order is important, i.e., you have to delete entity A which links to entity B that links to RootInfo before you delete B. So the returned list should have A.ID then B.ID.

      • delete

        void delete(RootInfo info)
        This should delete the archived object. It is called after the commit.
        Parameters:
        info - the root info for the graph's root object that was deleted. Implementation note: 1. Note that this is after the commit, so should never fail. 2. The info entity has already been deleted, so attempting to set or access array elements will throw an exception.

      • retrieveSchema

        java.io.InputStream retrieveSchema(int platformMajorVersion,
                                 int platformMinorVersion,
                                 int appMajorVersion,
                                 int appMinorVersion,
                                 int extensionVersion)
        This will retrieve the schema for the specified version.
        Parameters:
        platformMajorVersion - the platform major version number
        platformMinorVersion - the platform minor version number
        appMajorVersion - the application major version number
        appMinorVersion - the applciation minor version number
        extensionVersion - the extension version number
        Returns:
        the schema

      • storeSchema

        void storeSchema(int platformMajorVersion,
               int platformMinorVersion,
               int appMajorVersion,
               int appMinorVersion,
               int extensionVersion,
               java.io.InputStream schema)
        This will save the schema for the specified version.
        Parameters:
        platformMajorVersion - the platform major version number
        platformMinorVersion - the platform minor version number
        appMajorVersion - the application major version number
        appMinorVersion - the applciation minor version number
        extensionVersion - the extension version number
        schema - the schema
